newsArray.title: Everton want to sign attacker with 17 G+A in 22/23, transfer on the cards - report
creator: Pranav Shahaney
newsArray.description: Everton are battling Marseille in the race to sign Watford winger Ismaila Sarr this summer, according to an exclusive by Santi Aouna. The Foot Mercato journalist took to Twitter to claim [22 July] that Marseille already had an offer on the table for him. Talks are ongoing with Watford over the transfer but the Senegal ... The post Everton want to sign attacker with 17 G+A in 22/23, transfer on the cards - report appeared first on Goodison News.
newsArray.content: The Foot Mercato journalist took to Twitter to claim [22 July] that Marseille already had an offer on the table for him. Talks are ongoing with Watford over the transfer but the Senegal international, 25, is open to moving to the Ligue 1 outfit this summer. Via , Aouna wrote, ‚ÄúMore details on Sarr ‚Äì OM: A first offer has already been sent by OM to the player. The Watford striker is interested. Discussions already started with the Hornets. Interest from Everton. File not linked to Iliman Ndiaye.‚Äù Sarr‚Äôs someone who‚Äôs played in the Premier League and has adapted extremely well to English football so it‚Äôs not like the country does not suit him. In fact, last season, he bagged 10 goals and seven assists in the league and was one of the Hornets‚Äô star players. He‚Äôll obviously want to leave for a top-flight side and there are no surprises that he‚Äôs open to moving to Marseille. However, should Everton come knocking at his door, there‚Äôs a very good case to be made for the 25-year-old to move to Goodison Park. Sean Dyche will absolutely love him as he can play on either flank, down the middle and even as a number 10. In fact, in the four games he played in that shadow striker role last season, he scored one and provided two assists so that could be a role he could thrive in playing behind the striker in a 4-2-3-1 system.

newsArray.title: How to Watch Arsenal vs Manchester United Live Streaming Online? Get Telecast Details of Club Friendly 2023 Football Match With Time in IST
newsArray.description: The Red Devils have defeated Leeds United and Lyon in their opening two games of the pre-season campaign which bodes well for them. Scroll down to get live streaming and telecast details.
newsArray.content: Arsenal will be preparing themselves with a clash with PL rivals Manchester United in a pre-season match on Sunday, July 23 early morning. The game will begin at 02:30 am IST (Indian Standard Time) at MetLife Stadium, East Rutherford, New Jersey, USA. Unfortunately, fans would not be able to watch live telecast of the match on their TV sets in India. Since there are no official broadcast partners, fans in India would not be able to watch this match live on their TV sets. Although the live telecast of this match won't be available for the pre-season games, fans can enjoy live streaming of this contest. Fans can stream the game online on MUTV and Arsenal.com with the match passes. newsArray.title: Arsenal vs Man United - pre-season: Live score, team news and updates with Kai Havertz in line to make his first start for the Gunners against the Red Devils
newsArray.description: Follow Mail Sport's live blog for the pre-season clash between Arsenal and Manchester United in New Jersey. The Gunners defeated the MLS All Stars 5-0 on Thursday as United beat Lyon 1-0 last week.
newsArray.content: LIVE Arsenal vs Man United - pre-season: Live score, team news and updates as Andre Onana misses out on a debut while Declan Rice make first start for Arsenal By Ed Carruthers For Mailonline Updated: 21:57 BST, 22 July 2023 e-mail 704 shares 54 View comments Advertisement Follow Mail Sport's live blog for the pre-season clash between Arsenal and Manchester United in New Jersey. Ed Carruthers Host commentator 21:57 Is now the time to deliver for Mikel Arteta Tonight‚Äôs match will present a very big measuring stick for Mikel Arteta‚Äôs side to see where they are. With new faces in the squad the Arsenal manager has put up a strong side to take on Erik ten Hag‚Äôs team. But after the disappointment of last season with Arsenal falling short of the Premier League title, the club have been spending in the transfer window and have brought in some very exciting talents. Jurrien Timber, Declan Rice and Kai Havertz will all start tonight and it is an interesting night for the Gunners fans out there to see how they get on tonight. Havertz is perhaps. The most interesting of the three, having scored in his last outing for the Gunners in their 5-0 win against the MLS All Stars. If he gets back to his form of old he could be a pivotal player for Arteta this season. It will also be very interesting to see how Declan Rice fits in alongside Martin Odegaard and Jorginho tonight, after the former West Ham captain made his debut for the club last week. Arsenal's ¬£200m spending spree means Mikel Arteta MUST now deliver ISAAN KHAN IN NEW JERSEY: Arteta knows he must go one step further after being handed the tools he requested. There is a strength in depth to this squad that has not been there in recent years. Mail Online 21:43 Takeover talk: Avram Glazer turns up at United's US training camp Interestingly, Avram Glazer turned up at United's training camp and met with Erik ten Hag earlier this week. United are still in the midst of a takeover, and the Dutch manager told the media that he would be happy to give his 'advice and recommendations' to the owners over the takeover saga. More below... Man United owner Avram Glazer turns up at club's US training camp CHRIS WHEELER IN NEW JERSEY: Glazer has been the most visible member of the family, turning up at the finals of the FA Cup and Carabao Cup last season as well as the Women's FA Cup final. Mail Online 21:40 A busy week for Erik ten Hag Erik ten Hag has certainly had plenty to think about this week. The Man United boss ticked off another box bringing Andre Onana into his squad following David de Gea's departure. He also stripped Harry Maguire of the captains arm band and gave the leadership duties to Bruno Fernandes. But the Dutch manager is still hoping to make a few more signings before the end of the transfer window with United hoping to bring in a new striker following the departure of Wout Weghorst last season. Weghorst failed to score goals up top and the Red Devils are eyeing up Rasmus Hojlund as a replacement. In fact, the Dutch manager yesterday vowed that he would be signing a striker this summer despite the club being frustrated by Atalanta's ¬£86million price tag. ‚ÄòWe will do everything that's in our power to get the right man in,‚Äô said Ten Hag. ‚ÄòYou never know in the transfer market, but we know our targets and we‚Äôll do everything we can. We put every effort in to get this done because it's an area where we need improvement. ‚ÄòWe proved also last season we can be very successful even though we didn't have too many strikers. I expect more from the front players, a high level. They have to raise the bar and we expect more goals.‚Äô Erik ten Hag vows Man United 'will do everything' to sign a striker CHRIS WHEELER: United have acquired midfielder Mason Mount and goalkeeper Andre Onana in this transfer window, but Ten Hag has made signing a new centre-forward a priority. Mail Online 21:33 And United are in the house too! And Manchester United are in the house too! (Photo by Matthew Peters/Manchester United via Getty Images) 21:27 Arsenal have arrived! The Gunners are in the house! The team are taking in all the atmosphere at this enormous stadium and seem in good spirits ahead of the match. It also looks like Arsenal are set to wear their jazzy new yellow away kit that has received a lot of attention from some among their fan base with some saying the controversial design is 'not appropriate for Champions League football .' Let me know what you reckon to the new shirt in the comments! Check out some action shots below! (Photo by Stuart MacFarlane/Arsenal FC via Getty Images) 21:21 Andre Onana misses out Erik ten Hag has chosen to leave new signing Andre Onana out of his matchday squad. The shot-stopper jetted into New Jersey on Friday after completing his ¬£47million move from Inter Milan. Interestingly, the Serie A outfit are currently interested in signing David de Gea, who made way for the Cameroonian following what was an unceremonious departure from Old Trafford earlier this summer. Onana, meanwhile immediately begun training with the Red Devils this week in the States, but will not feature tonight. Tom Heaton, who was refused a move to Luton this summer, will start in net for the match with Dean Henderson edging closer to a move to Nottingham Forest. Andre Onana undergoes his first Manchester United training session Manchester United's new goalkeeper Andre Onana got to work as the club's new number one for the first time on Friday after joining team-mates for a training session in New Jersey. Mail Online 21:10 Rice and Timber make the starting XI Following on from his landmark ¬£100m signing, Declan Rice will start for the first time in the middle of the park for Arsenal. It will be interesting tonight to how he combines with Martin Odegaard and Jorginho in the midfield tonight. It is a strong midfield trio from Arteta, but he‚Äôs also named Jurrien Timber at right-back, following his impressive game against the MLS All Stars. One of his greatest attributes is his passing ability and it could be a sign to come from Mikel Arteta, with Timber‚Äôs versatility giving him another option in defence alongside William Sailba, Gabriel and Takehiro Tomiyasu. Arsenal 5-0 MLS All-Stars - PLAYER RATINGS: Saka and Jesus shone Arsenal's attacking frontline showed why they would once again challenge Manchester City for the Premier League. The same could not be said for the best and brightest MLS had to offer. The stadium boasts a top capacity of 82,500 and is the home of the New York Jets and New York Giants. Tonight it will host two Premier League rivals eager to get a win. But the stage is set and boy this does look to be an impressive arena! EAST RUTHERFORD, NEW JERSEY - JULY 22: A general view of the MetLife Stadium the home of NFL teams the New York Giants and Jets ahead of the USA summer friendly game between Arsenal and Manchester United at MetLife Stadium on July 22, 2023 in East Rutherford, New Jersey. (Photo by Matthew Ashton - AMA/Getty Images) EAST RUTHERFORD, NEW JERSEY - JULY 22: Fans of Manchester United with red flares outside the Met Life Stadium ahead of the USA summer friendly game between Arsenal and Manchester United at MetLife Stadium on July 22, 2023 in East Rutherford, New Jersey. (Photo by Matthew Ashton - AMA/Getty Images) EAST RUTHERFORD, NEW JERSEY - JULY 22: Fans of Arsenal walk to the stadium ahead of the USA summer friendly game between Arsenal and Manchester United at MetLife Stadium on July 22, 2023 in East Rutherford, New Jersey. (Photo by Matthew Ashton - AMA/Getty Images) 20:45 Pre-season is well and truly underway! Arsenal come into this epic clash having beaten the MLS All Stars 5-0 earlier this week. It was their second pre-season match after Mikel Arteta‚Äôs side kick started their summer preparations with a 1-1 draw against FC Nurnberg last week. But the Gunners showed their quality on Thursday night, putting five past Wayne Rooney‚Äôs side with Bukayo Saka and Gabriel Jesus proving a nuisance all game against the US outfit. The Brazilian would get on the scoresheet alongside Leandro Trossard, Jorginho, Gabriel Martinelli and new signing Kai Havertz - who could be in line to make his first start for the club tonight. Erik ten Hag‚Äôs team meanwhile, bested French side Lyon 1-0 in their opening match, with Donny van de Been getting on the scoresheet just before half-time. They also defeated Leeds 2-0 in their first pre-season warm-up, with ¬£60m signing Mason Mount making his first start in a Red Devils jersey during the match. Andre Onana could also make an appearance tonight with the shot-stopper arriving in Manchester earlier this week to complete his move from Inter Milan. Manchester United 1-0 Lyon: Van de Beek nets winner as Evans returns Donny van de Beek scored on his return to action to give Manchester United a 1-0 pre-season victory over Lyon. newsArray.title: Genk 2-0 Burnley: Vincent Kompany's men suffer first pre-season defeat in Belgium as James Trafford makes debut following ¬£19m Manchester City switch
newsArray.description: An eighth-minute goal from Yira Sor and a late hit from Tolu Arokodare saw the Belgians over the line on a frustrating evening for Vincent Kompany.
newsArray.content: Genk 2-0 Burnley: Vincent Kompany's men suffer first pre-season defeat in Belgium as James Trafford makes debut following ¬£19m Manchester City switch Burnley fell 2-0 to Belgian league runners-up Genk after early and late strikes James Trafford made his debut and Andros Townsend played as a trialist Vincent Kompany's side suffered their first pre-season loss in Belgium By Luke Power For Mailonline Updated: 16:12 EDT, 22 July 2023 e-mail 161 shares View comments Burnley 's unbeaten pre-season record has been ripped up as they lost 2-0 at KRC Genk. An eighth-minute goal from Yira Sor and a late hit from Tolu Arokodare saw the Belgians over the line on a frustrating evening for Vincent Kompany . James Trafford made his debut between the sticks for the Lancashire outfit after signing for ¬£19m from Manchester City but could not carry his clean sheets record from the U21s Euros into this game. Striker Zeki Amdouni, who recently signed from Basel after 22 goals there last season , came on as a substitute, while Andros Townsend featured as a trialist. It was a nightmare start for the Clarets when Sor converted just eight minutes after kick-off, following up after Angelo Preciado's effort was blocked. James Trafford, pictured after winning the U21s Euros with England, debuted as Burnley lost Vincent Kompany's side are preparing for their first season back in the Premier League after winning the Championship Josh Brownhill looked to get his side back in it around 16 minutes in but saw his attempted denied by a defender's legs. Scott Twine was a lively presence for Burnley and could have scored in either half. He rapped a half-volley wide of the mark early into the second half. The hosts almost added a second when new signing Christopher Bonsu Baah smacked a long-range attempt, but it went wide. But Genk got their reward for persistence in the closing minutes as Arokodare found the net for the home side in their last pre-season friendly. newsArray.title: Harry Kane's wife, Kate, has been 'looking at properties in Munich' as he edges closer to Bayern move
newsArray.description: The German club are currently leading the race to sign him after Daniel Levy slapped a ¬£100million valuation on the England captain, deterring many other clubs from signing him.
newsArray.content: Harry Kane's house hunt! Tottenham striker's wife, Kate, has been 'looking at properties in Munich' as Bayern edge closer to signing England star Harry Kane's wife, Kate, has reportedly been looking at properties in Munich It comes as the Tottenham star is edging closer to an exit from the London club Bayern Munich are leading the race and are set to table a third offer this week By Ed Carruthers For Mailonline Updated: 21:07 BST, 22 July 2023 e-mail 5 shares 13 View comments Harry Kane's wife, Kate, has sensationally been reported to be 'looking at properties in Munich' as the Tottenham star edges closer to a move to Bayern Munich. The German club are currently leading the race to sign him after Daniel Levy slapped a ¬£100million valuation on the England captain, deterring many other clubs including Manchester United off from signing him . But that valuation has not stopped the German champions from tabling bids for Kane, with Thomas Tuchel's side set to make their third offer for him this week , after having their previous bids of ¬£60m and an improved price of ¬£70m rejected . The striker, who turns 30 this week, travelled with Ange Postecoglou's side to Asia and could feature in Sunday's pre-season friendly against Leicester in Thailand. The Australian manager on Saturday admitted in a press conference that he expects the club's all-time top scorer to stay despite interest from Bayern and is planning for next season with Kane in his squad. Harry Kane (pictured) is edging closer to a move to Bayern Munich with the German champions set to make their third bid to sign him But a report from German outlet Bild has claimed that his wife, Kate (right), has been looking at properties in Munich Thomas Tuchel's (pictured) side have already offered ¬£70million to sign Kane but are set to improve that bid and submit a third offer this week But in a sensational report from Bild , Kane's wife has been reportedly 'looking at properties in Munich and the district of Grunwald in Bavaria.' The German news outlet are also claiming that other members of Kane's family have been in the German city 'in the past few days to look at international schools and properties'. Kane and his partner married in 2019 and are known childhood sweethearts. The pair have three children together and have recently announced that they are expecting a fourth . Questions have been mounting over whether the 29-year-old should move to Germany , with the Spurs striker still able to break Alan Shearer's record of being the Premier League's all-time leading goal scorer. Kane (pictured) travelled with Tottenham's pre-season training squad to Asia and could feature in tomorrow's friendly against Leicester But the German side seems to be Kane's preferred option after Mail Sport reported this week that he would not be keen on a move to Paris Saint Germain . In any event, while Spurs are hopeful he will stay, they are making contingency plans for life without the England captain. Levy is reportedly stepping up plans to bring in Fiorentina's Arthur Cabral , a robust forward who scored 19 goals in 64 appearances since moving to Italy in January 2022. Kane's contract will expire in 2024 with Tottenham having already tabled a very lucrative deal to try and keep him at the club. newsArray.title: NFL free agent Dalvin Cook offered his ex-girlfriend $1 million to drop domestic violence claims, according to new filing in ongoing lawsuit as running back is linked with Jets
newsArray.description: Cook - a free agent this offseason - also allegedly asked his ex-partner to deny abuse claims with a sworn affidavit and to send the NFL a letter clearing him of wrongdoing in exchange for money.
newsArray.content: NFL free agent Dalvin Cook offered his ex-girlfriend $1 million to drop domestic violence claims, according to new filing in ongoing lawsuit as running back is linked with Jets Gracelyn Tremble alleges that Cook falsely imprisoned, abused & concussed her The 27-year-old running back is seeking a $10millino contract as a free agent DailyMail.com provides all the latest international sports news By Alastair Talbot For Dailymail.Com Updated: 21:00, 22 July 2023 e-mail View comments Dalvin Cook offered his ex-girlfriend $1million to drop her domestic violence claims, according to a new legal filing in an ongoing 2021 lawsuit filed in Minnesota , amid the New York Jets ' reported interest in the free agent. The 27-year-old running back made two settlement offers of $800,000, then $1M to his accuser, Gracelyn Trimble - a former US Army sergeant - hoping that she would refrain from testifying against him, per a recent filing from the accuser's lawyer. Cook, who was released by the Vikings in the spring, also asked his former partner to deny the abuse accusation with a sworn affidavit and that she send league officials a letter clearing his name of any wrongdoing in exchange for the six-figure cash offer. Tremble alleges that Cook abused her, caused a brain injury, and held her hostage at his home in a suburb of Minneapolis in November 2020. She claims that she flew into Minnesota's capital to break up with the football player and to collect her belongings. Free agent running back Dalvin Cook is facing domestic violence claims from a 2020 lawsuit Gracelyn Trimble - Cook's ex - claims she was offered $800k than $1M to stay quiet by Cook Trimble also alleges that she was physically and mentally abused several times by the NFL star Instead, Cook 'grabbed her by her arm and slung her whole body over the couch, slamming her face into the coffee table and causing her lower forehead and the bridge of her nose to bust open,' according to legal papers recently filed in Dakota-County District Court, first obtained by The Minneapolis Star-Tribune . Details of the filing are sealed. DailyMail.com has contacted both parties' attorneys for immediate comment. Timber also alleges that Cook followed her upstairs when she went to clean off the blood, throwing her down and pinning her to the ground before punching and choking her. He then allegedly grabbed his rifle and yelled death threats while holding her at gunpoint, according to the filing. What's more is that Timber claims that Cook beat her with a broomstick, threw her against a wall and kicked her in the hips and ribs while she laid on the ground before she ran out of his home in search of help. He later got her back into the house and confiscated her phone, the filing reports. Police were not called to the scene, a the time of the incident. This photograph from Trimble's filing shows a cut to the back of her head she blames on Cook Trimble also included several online exchanges with Cook in a sealed filing made by her lawyer Trimble did not call police to report the incident at the time and is a former US Army sergeant Trimble, pictured in her Army uniform, and Cook broke up 'for good' in May of last year A private message sent by Cook on Instagram that was included in the filing reads: 'I know what I did can be rewind...if you wanna go to the police I'll respect that I'll take my punishment for what I did! Cook, who is seeking $10M as a free agent this offseason, countersued for fraud and defamation. A police report was only filed in May of last year after the pair broke up 'for good,' according to The New York Post . Cook was involved in all of the Vikings' 17 NFL games last season, rushing for 1,173 yards. His agent, Zac Hiller, flirted with the Jets in a recent podcast interview, saying the franchise has 'a great thing going' after trading for Aaron Rodgers. But, for Cook to join New York, he would have to decrease his salary demands. The Jets have Michael Carter and Breece Hall as their only two running backs for this upcoming season. newsArray.title: Chelsea could lose wonderkid, 21, to Prem rivals for just ¬£10m with star available on free transfer next summer
creator: Ciaran Wiseman
newsArray.content: BURNLEY are trying to agree a fee for Ian Maatsen ‚Äî despite the left-back starring for Chelsea in pre-season. Maatsen , 21, was a big part of the Clarets‚Äô Championship title win last season. The Dutchman is out of contract next summer and Burnley hope to agree a ¬£10million fee plus extras. Clarets keeper Bailey Peacock-Farrell , 26, is clear to sign for Danish side Aarhus following James Trafford‚Äôs arrival. Sheffield Wednesday and Birmingham were keen, too. The Blues have also been battling to keep hold of fellow youngster Levi Colwill . Colwill starred on loan at Brighton last season, with the Seagulls amongst the clubs chasing a permanent move this summer. Chelsea are determined to keep hold of the defender, though, as they also chase additions to their squad. Brighton's Moises Caicedo has been strongly linked with a move to Stamford Bridge, with a ¬£70million bid already rejected . Seagulls boss Roberto De Zerbi has even hinted at pursuing a swap deal that would see Caicedo and Colwill moving between the two clubs. FREE BETS AND SIGN UP DEALS - BEST NEW CUSTOMER OFFERS TRANSFER NEWS LIVE: All the latest news, rumours and confirmed switches from the world of football Speaking in a press conference this week, he explained: "There are two questions. "Not only about Caicedo, also about Colwill, and maybe it can be [a swap]. "I would like to play with Caicedo and Colwill together but at the moment I can only speak about Caicedo as Colwill is not one of my players."

newsArray.title: Ashley Young insists Sean Dyche is the man to turn Everton around after back-to-back relegation battles... as the 38-year-old veteran claims it was a 'no brainer' to join Toffees this summer
newsArray.description: JOE BERNSTEIN: Young, who played alongside Sean Dyche at Watford two decades ago, describe his decision to join Everton as a 'no-brainer' after being released by Aston Villa.
newsArray.content: Ashley Young insists Sean Dyche is the man to turn Everton around after back-to-back relegation battles... as the 38-year-old veteran claims it was a 'no brainer' to join Toffees this summer Ashley Young joined his former Watford captain Sean Dyche for free this summer The 38-year-old insists Dyche is the man to help turn Everton's fortunes around Young scored on his debut as the Toffees beat League One side Wigan 1-0 By Joe Bernstein for The Mail on Sunday Updated: 20:00 BST, 22 July 2023 e-mail View comments The Everton anthem proclaims them as 'a grand old team to support' so perhaps the arrival of 38-year-old Ashley Young will prove a masterstroke. Young, who played alongside Sean Dyche when he began his career at Watford two decades ago, describe his decision to join Everton as a 'no-brainer' after being released by Aston Villa . And despite the cynics claiming the move only highlighted Everton's financial predicament, the former Manchester United , Inter Milan and England star enjoyed a fantastic debut yesterday as a winger, scoring the only goal in a 1-0 win at Wigan. Tougher challenges like ahead for sure. Everton have been perilously close to relegation in each of the last two seasons and they need to survive on a relative shoestring for one more season in order to move into their new stadium at Bramley-Moore Dock in August 2024 as a Premier League club. The club haven't paid a transfer fee for a permanent signing in the last two transfer windows and are in special measures having reported heavy financial losses over three years. Ashley Young joined Everton for free this summer after being released by Aston Villa The 38-year-old is adamant former team-mate Sean Dyche can help turn the Toffees' fortunes But Young is adamant having agreed his move to Merseyside that the Everton glass should remain half-full because of Dyche being at the helm. After all, he's a manager used to punching above his weight at Burnley and three of his squad at Turf Moore ‚Äì Dwight McNeil, James Tarkowski and Michael Keane ‚Äì are now at Goodison. 'When I played alongside Sean, I could tell he would go into management. He has that winning mentality, that spark when he walks into a dressing-room, you're aware of that presence,' he explains. 'Him and Everton is a good match and from what I've seen so far, all the players are willing to buy into it 'I knew he wanted me at Burnley before I went to Aston Villa so it was extra pull to join Everton besides the fans, players and size of the club. 'Obviously the last two seasons haven't gone as well as they should but he has the mentality to take the club higher up the table where they should be. 'The last couple of years wasn't going to put me off joining. When you put a challenge in front of me, I go full throttle. Monaco-based Farhad Moshiri (pictured) has been an absentee owner in recent years Dyche wanted watched the U21s team play on Saturday to see what he's got coming through 'They've not had a settled manager but what Sean gives, I'm feeling positive.' Certainly, Everton need some of that positivity from Young. They've become a selling club over recent times and Monaco-based Farhad Moshiri an absentee owner. He's had to take on loans to secure the building of the stadium which has impacted on the playing squad. Fans were so discontented, directors didn't go to Goodison for the second part of last season. They played well at Wigan on Saturday but it was significant assistant Ian Woan took charge because Dyche wanted to see the under-21s team play instead to see what he's got coming through. The absences of Dominic Calvert-Lewin and Amadou Onana with injuries will also be concerning given the Premier League begins in three weeks. Demarai Gray has been given time off after playing for Jamaica in the Gold Cup and he may or may not return given there is interest from other clubs. Luckily for Everton, Young is Mr Versatility and having spent his latter years as a wing-back, he looked good as a left-sided attacker, even breaking into the box to hit the winner after 63 minutes before gaining a standing ovation from hundreds of Evertonians when he was substituted later on. 'It is fluid where I'll be used. As a player you have to be ready to play in different positions,' said Young. Young (centre) insists he can't wait to play in front of the Goodison crowd next season 'I am one of those players who gives 100 per cent whatever position the manager wants. I can't wait to get to Goodison and play for the badge. I know the home fans are loud and noisy and will give everything back to you. When you get a chance to play for a big club like Everton it was a no-brainer.' One of Young's happiest Goodison memories was scoring the winner for Villa which prompted Martin O'Neill to label him a 'genius'. Everton will need a few of those this season though fans should also remember the third line of their club song which begins 'And If you know your history' The last time things looked this bleak, in 2004 when they finished 17th and then sold Wayne Rooney, David Moyes battened down the hatches the following season and Everton surprised everyone to finish in the top four! newsArray.title: Man Utd to trigger one-year deal for Wan-Bissaka despite Crystal Palace interest with transfer set to fall through
creator: Ian Tuckey
newsArray.content: MANCHESTER UNITED look ready to take up the extra year‚Äôs option on right-back Aaron Wan-Bissaka. The ex- Crystal Palace player, 25, is out of contract next summer but United have the chance to keep him beyond that. Palace would like Wan-Bissaka to return to Selhurst Park but they will not have any joy because United plan to keep the defender, who has impressed manager Erik ten Hag. The Dutchman wants to sign Axel Disasi, 25, for the position but the fee is too big and takeover issues make it difficult. Monaco may yet sell Disasi so Ten Hag is on alert ‚Äî especially if Diogo Dalot leaves Old Trafford. But Arsenal and Chelsea could be ready to nip in with a bid. It's thought that Monaco rate the four-cap Frenchman at around ¬£34million. He played all 38 of their Ligue 1 games last term. The Gunners' need for rearguard reinforcements has been eased by Jurrien Timber's arrival from Ajax . But new Chelsea chief Mauricio Pochettino wants to strengthen his squad all round. BETTING SPECIAL - BEST NO DEPOSIT CASINO OFFERS And the Blues let centre-back Kalidou Koulibaly join Saudi side Al-Hilal . United, meanwhile, appear mainly focused on bringing in a new world-class striker. But they might have to cough up close to ¬£86m for Atalanta's Rasmus Hojlund . newsArray.title: Arsenal's ¬£200m spending spree this summer means Mikel Arteta MUST now deliver... Man City and other rivals will take notice but new signings mean the future looks bright
newsArray.description: ISAAN KHAN IN NEW JERSEY: Arteta knows he must go one step further after being handed the tools he requested. There is a strength in depth to this squad that has not been there in recent years.
newsArray.content: Arsenal's ¬£200m spending spree this summer means Mikel Arteta MUST now deliver... Man City and other rivals will take notice but new signings mean the future looks bright Mikel Arteta knows he must deliver this year after a ¬£200million summer splurge The signings of Rice, Timber, and Havertz mean they have a new-found depth Stan Kroenke's American sports teams have thrived after investment recently By Isaan Khan For Mailonline Updated: 19:59 BST, 22 July 2023 e-mail 20 shares 10 View comments It was a couple of words in the lengthy dissections over what went wrong that gave away what was on the mind of Mikel Arteta in May. The party line from those within the club highlighted how much of an achievement it was for Arsenal to push Manchester City right to the wire. Besides, the north London club had finished fifth the season before ‚Äì they had last finished runners-up in 2015-16 under Arsene Wenger. This was a stark improvement. But, in reality, Arteta and Co knew they had scuppered a golden chance. It was in their hands ‚Äî until they secured three consecutive draws and a humiliation to City in April . They had choked. The following month, Arteta told Spanish newspaper Marca : ‚ÄòTo this day, it still hurts me deeply not having won the Premier League after spending 10 months fighting City. ‚ÄòThere were three or four injuries to important players and from there, everything got complicated. Mikel Arteta knows Arsenal must make another title tilt after receiving financial backing Stan Kroenke expects results after investing. His Denver Nuggets won the NBA Finals in June Arsenal won 5-0 against the MLS All-Stars team thanks to a strong first-team performance ‚ÄòWhen we had the full team, we were consistent. As soon as problems came, we couldn‚Äôt be consistent.‚Äô The message was clear: a Premier League title can only be won with a bigger, stronger squad. That warning has been more than heeded by owner Stan Kroenke , who has since splurged over ¬£200million in the past month. The signings of Kai Havertz , Jurrien Timber and Declan Rice were decisively made at the start of the window, allowing the players time to bed into the manager‚Äôs demands and plot how they can wrestle back the league this time around. It has translated into a sheer sense of optimism surrounding this club. During training near Washington DC, smiles and team bonding were commonplace. Rice, for instance, has shown signs of leadership both on and off the pitch on this US tour, and is already clearly respected among this group. Following the 5-0 thrashing of the MLS All-Stars in Washington, D.C., Arteta was beaming as he said: ‚ÄòThe idea is to be more unpredictable every year and more difficult for the opponents to stop us. We have, especially in the back and midfield, many more options than we had last season.‚Äô Though beneath the sheen of optimism, the amount of pressure, which was already heightened, is now further ramped up. When Kroenke invests heavily, he expects results. He also has had the recent taste of winning big in many sports, bar football. You only have to look at the trajectory of the other teams he owns in various league across the US. In the past 17 months, three of his clubs have won major championships. The Denver Nuggets, Los Angeles Rams and Colorado Avalanche have won an NBA Championship , the Super Bowl, and the Stanley Cup respectively. Arteta knows he must go one step further this season, especially after being handed the tools he requested. Though it is a challenge he will relish, and one which so far does not appear unfathomable. Declan Rice is the marquee signing of the summer and is already a leader in the Arsenal squad Jurrien Timber signed a five-year deal in his ¬£40.5million move from Dutch giants Ajax New man Kai Havertz was on the scoresheet against the MLS All-Stars and adds forward depth There is a sheen of optimism at Arsenal but this season they must deliver after huge spending The All-Stars match saw the manager give 21 players a chance across the 90 minutes. The performance levels did not dip, and nor was there a feeling of multiple second-string players coming on to fill the gaps. There really is a strength in depth to this squad that has not been there in recent years, and which will be noticed by their league rivals ‚Äî including Pep Guardiola‚Äôs City. The new signings also showed in glimpses why they were so sought after by the Gunners. Timber utilised unorthodox positions across the backline, Rice marshalled his team-mates into the correct positions, and Havertz put his volley challenge nightmare from the day before behind him to put in a composed display . The signs look bright indeed, but the required goal is unquestionable. Share or comment on this article: Arsenal's ¬£200m spending spree this summer means Mikel Arteta MUST now deliver... newsArray.title: Everton want to sign attacker with 17 G+A in 22/23, transfer on the cards - report
creator: Pranav Shahaney
newsArray.description: Everton are battling Marseille in the race to sign Watford winger Ismaila Sarr this summer, according to an exclusive by Santi Aouna. The Foot Mercato journalist took to Twitter to claim [22 July] that Marseille already had an offer on the table for him. Talks are ongoing with Watford over the transfer but the Senegal ... The post Everton want to sign attacker with 17 G+A in 22/23, transfer on the cards - report appeared first on Goodison News.
newsArray.content: The Foot Mercato journalist took to Twitter to claim [22 July] that Marseille already had an offer on the table for him. Talks are ongoing with Watford over the transfer but the Senegal international, 25, is open to moving to the Ligue 1 outfit this summer. Via , Aouna wrote, ‚ÄúMore details on Sarr ‚Äì OM: A first offer has already been sent by OM to the player. The Watford striker is interested. Discussions already started with the Hornets. Interest from Everton. File not linked to Iliman Ndiaye.‚Äù Sarr‚Äôs someone who‚Äôs played in the Premier League and has adapted extremely well to English football so it‚Äôs not like the country does not suit him. In fact, last season, he bagged 10 goals and seven assists in the league and was one of the Hornets‚Äô star players. He‚Äôll obviously want to leave for a top-flight side and there are no surprises that he‚Äôs open to moving to Marseille. However, should Everton come knocking at his door, there‚Äôs a very good case to be made for the 25-year-old to move to Goodison Park. Sean Dyche will absolutely love him as he can play on either flank, down the middle and even as a number 10. In fact, in the four games he played in that shadow striker role last season, he scored one and provided two assists so that could be a role he could thrive in playing behind the striker in a 4-2-3-1 system.

newsArray.title: Arsenal vs Man United - pre-season: Live score, team news and updates with Kai Havertz in line to make his first start for the Gunners against the Red Devils
newsArray.description: Follow Mail Sport's live blog for the pre-season clash between Arsenal and Manchester United in New Jersey. The Gunners defeated the MLS All Stars 5-0 on Thursday as United beat Lyon 1-0 last week.
newsArray.content: LIVE Arsenal vs Man United - pre-season: Live score, team news and updates as Andre Onana misses out on a debut while Declan Rice make first start for Arsenal By Ed Carruthers For Mailonline Updated: 21:57 BST, 22 July 2023 e-mail 704 shares 54 View comments Advertisement Follow Mail Sport's live blog for the pre-season clash between Arsenal and Manchester United in New Jersey. Ed Carruthers Host commentator 21:57 Is now the time to deliver for Mikel Arteta Tonight‚Äôs match will present a very big measuring stick for Mikel Arteta‚Äôs side to see where they are. With new faces in the squad the Arsenal manager has put up a strong side to take on Erik ten Hag‚Äôs team. But after the disappointment of last season with Arsenal falling short of the Premier League title, the club have been spending in the transfer window and have brought in some very exciting talents. Jurrien Timber, Declan Rice and Kai Havertz will all start tonight and it is an interesting night for the Gunners fans out there to see how they get on tonight. Havertz is perhaps. The most interesting of the three, having scored in his last outing for the Gunners in their 5-0 win against the MLS All Stars. If he gets back to his form of old he could be a pivotal player for Arteta this season. It will also be very interesting to see how Declan Rice fits in alongside Martin Odegaard and Jorginho tonight, after the former West Ham captain made his debut for the club last week. Arsenal's ¬£200m spending spree means Mikel Arteta MUST now deliver ISAAN KHAN IN NEW JERSEY: Arteta knows he must go one step further after being handed the tools he requested. There is a strength in depth to this squad that has not been there in recent years. Mail Online 21:43 Takeover talk: Avram Glazer turns up at United's US training camp Interestingly, Avram Glazer turned up at United's training camp and met with Erik ten Hag earlier this week. United are still in the midst of a takeover, and the Dutch manager told the media that he would be happy to give his 'advice and recommendations' to the owners over the takeover saga. More below... Man United owner Avram Glazer turns up at club's US training camp CHRIS WHEELER IN NEW JERSEY: Glazer has been the most visible member of the family, turning up at the finals of the FA Cup and Carabao Cup last season as well as the Women's FA Cup final. Mail Online 21:40 A busy week for Erik ten Hag Erik ten Hag has certainly had plenty to think about this week. The Man United boss ticked off another box bringing Andre Onana into his squad following David de Gea's departure. He also stripped Harry Maguire of the captains arm band and gave the leadership duties to Bruno Fernandes. But the Dutch manager is still hoping to make a few more signings before the end of the transfer window with United hoping to bring in a new striker following the departure of Wout Weghorst last season. Weghorst failed to score goals up top and the Red Devils are eyeing up Rasmus Hojlund as a replacement. In fact, the Dutch manager yesterday vowed that he would be signing a striker this summer despite the club being frustrated by Atalanta's ¬£86million price tag. ‚ÄòWe will do everything that's in our power to get the right man in,‚Äô said Ten Hag. ‚ÄòYou never know in the transfer market, but we know our targets and we‚Äôll do everything we can. We put every effort in to get this done because it's an area where we need improvement. ‚ÄòWe proved also last season we can be very successful even though we didn't have too many strikers. I expect more from the front players, a high level. They have to raise the bar and we expect more goals.‚Äô Erik ten Hag vows Man United 'will do everything' to sign a striker CHRIS WHEELER: United have acquired midfielder Mason Mount and goalkeeper Andre Onana in this transfer window, but Ten Hag has made signing a new centre-forward a priority. (Photo by Matthew Ashton - AMA/Getty Images) 20:45 Pre-season is well and truly underway! Arsenal come into this epic clash having beaten the MLS All Stars 5-0 earlier this week. It was their second pre-season match after Mikel Arteta‚Äôs side kick started their summer preparations with a 1-1 draw against FC Nurnberg last week. But the Gunners showed their quality on Thursday night, putting five past Wayne Rooney‚Äôs side with Bukayo Saka and Gabriel Jesus proving a nuisance all game against the US outfit. The Brazilian would get on the scoresheet alongside Leandro Trossard, Jorginho, Gabriel Martinelli and new signing Kai Havertz - who could be in line to make his first start for the club tonight. Erik ten Hag‚Äôs team meanwhile, bested French side Lyon 1-0 in their opening match, with Donny van de Been getting on the scoresheet just before half-time. They also defeated Leeds 2-0 in their first pre-season warm-up, with ¬£60m signing Mason Mount making his first start in a Red Devils jersey during the match. Andre Onana could also make an appearance tonight with the shot-stopper arriving in Manchester earlier this week to complete his move from Inter Milan. newsArray.title: Genk 2-0 Burnley: Vincent Kompany's men suffer first pre-season defeat in Belgium as James Trafford makes debut following ¬£19m Manchester City switch
newsArray.description: An eighth-minute goal from Yira Sor and a late hit from Tolu Arokodare saw the Belgians over the line on a frustrating evening for Vincent Kompany.
newsArray.content: Genk 2-0 Burnley: Vincent Kompany's men suffer first pre-season defeat in Belgium as James Trafford makes debut following ¬£19m Manchester City switch Burnley fell 2-0 to Belgian league runners-up Genk after early and late strikes James Trafford made his debut and Andros Townsend played as a trialist Vincent Kompany's side suffered their first pre-season loss in Belgium By Luke Power For Mailonline Updated: 16:12 EDT, 22 July 2023 e-mail 161 shares View comments Burnley 's unbeaten pre-season record has been ripped up as they lost 2-0 at KRC Genk. An eighth-minute goal from Yira Sor and a late hit from Tolu Arokodare saw the Belgians over the line on a frustrating evening for Vincent Kompany . James Trafford made his debut between the sticks for the Lancashire outfit after signing for ¬£19m from Manchester City but could not carry his clean sheets record from the U21s Euros into this game. Striker Zeki Amdouni, who recently signed from Basel after 22 goals there last season , came on as a substitute, while Andros Townsend featured as a trialist. It was a nightmare start for the Clarets when Sor converted just eight minutes after kick-off, following up after Angelo Preciado's effort was blocked. James Trafford, pictured after winning the U21s Euros with England, debuted as Burnley lost Vincent Kompany's side are preparing for their first season back in the Premier League after winning the Championship Josh Brownhill looked to get his side back in it around 16 minutes in but saw his attempted denied by a defender's legs. Scott Twine was a lively presence for Burnley and could have scored in either half. He rapped a half-volley wide of the mark early into the second half. The hosts almost added a second when new signing Christopher Bonsu Baah smacked a long-range attempt, but it went wide. But Genk got their reward for persistence in the closing minutes as Arokodare found the net for the home side in their last pre-season friendly. newsArray.title: Harry Kane's wife, Kate, has been 'looking at properties in Munich' as he edges closer to Bayern move
newsArray.description: The German club are currently leading the race to sign him after Daniel Levy slapped a ¬£100million valuation on the England captain, deterring many other clubs from signing him.
newsArray.content: Harry Kane's house hunt! Tottenham striker's wife, Kate, has been 'looking at properties in Munich' as Bayern edge closer to signing England star Harry Kane's wife, Kate, has reportedly been looking at properties in Munich It comes as the Tottenham star is edging closer to an exit from the London club Bayern Munich are leading the race and are set to table a third offer this week By Ed Carruthers For Mailonline Updated: 21:07 BST, 22 July 2023 e-mail 5 shares 13 View comments Harry Kane's wife, Kate, has sensationally been reported to be 'looking at properties in Munich' as the Tottenham star edges closer to a move to Bayern Munich. The German club are currently leading the race to sign him after Daniel Levy slapped a ¬£100million valuation on the England captain, deterring many other clubs including Manchester United off from signing him . But that valuation has not stopped the German champions from tabling bids for Kane, with Thomas Tuchel's side set to make their third offer for him this week , after having their previous bids of ¬£60m and an improved price of ¬£70m rejected . The striker, who turns 30 this week, travelled with Ange Postecoglou's side to Asia and could feature in Sunday's pre-season friendly against Leicester in Thailand. The Australian manager on Saturday admitted in a press conference that he expects the club's all-time top scorer to stay despite interest from Bayern and is planning for next season with Kane in his squad. Harry Kane (pictured) is edging closer to a move to Bayern Munich with the German champions set to make their third bid to sign him But a report from German outlet Bild has claimed that his wife, Kate (right), has been looking at properties in Munich Thomas Tuchel's (pictured) side have already offered ¬£70million to sign Kane but are set to improve that bid and submit a third offer this week But in a sensational report from Bild , Kane's wife has been reportedly 'looking at properties in Munich and the district of Grunwald in Bavaria.' The German news outlet are also claiming that other members of Kane's family have been in the German city 'in the past few days to look at international schools and properties'. Kane and his partner married in 2019 and are known childhood sweethearts. The pair have three children together and have recently announced that they are expecting a fourth . Questions have been mounting over whether the 29-year-old should move to Germany , with the Spurs striker still able to break Alan Shearer's record of being the Premier League's all-time leading goal scorer. Kane (pictured) travelled with Tottenham's pre-season training squad to Asia and could feature in tomorrow's friendly against Leicester But the German side seems to be Kane's preferred option after Mail Sport reported this week that he would not be keen on a move to Paris Saint Germain . In any event, while Spurs are hopeful he will stay, they are making contingency plans for life without the England captain. Levy is reportedly stepping up plans to bring in Fiorentina's Arthur Cabral , a robust forward who scored 19 goals in 64 appearances since moving to Italy in January 2022. Kane's contract will expire in 2024 with Tottenham having already tabled a very lucrative deal to try and keep him at the club. newsArray.title: NFL free agent Dalvin Cook offered his ex-girlfriend $1 million to drop domestic violence claims, according to new filing in ongoing lawsuit as running back is linked with Jets
newsArray.description: Cook - a free agent this offseason - also allegedly asked his ex-partner to deny abuse claims with a sworn affidavit and to send the NFL a letter clearing him of wrongdoing in exchange for money.
newsArray.content: NFL free agent Dalvin Cook offered his ex-girlfriend $1 million to drop domestic violence claims, according to new filing in ongoing lawsuit as running back is linked with Jets Gracelyn Tremble alleges that Cook falsely imprisoned, abused & concussed her The 27-year-old running back is seeking a $10millino contract as a free agent DailyMail.com provides all the latest international sports news By Alastair Talbot For Dailymail.Com Updated: 21:00, 22 July 2023 e-mail View comments Dalvin Cook offered his ex-girlfriend $1million to drop her domestic violence claims, according to a new legal filing in an ongoing 2021 lawsuit filed in Minnesota , amid the New York Jets ' reported interest in the free agent. The 27-year-old running back made two settlement offers of $800,000, then $1M to his accuser, Gracelyn Trimble - a former US Army sergeant - hoping that she would refrain from testifying against him, per a recent filing from the accuser's lawyer. Cook, who was released by the Vikings in the spring, also asked his former partner to deny the abuse accusation with a sworn affidavit and that she send league officials a letter clearing his name of any wrongdoing in exchange for the six-figure cash offer. Tremble alleges that Cook abused her, caused a brain injury, and held her hostage at his home in a suburb of Minneapolis in November 2020. She claims that she flew into Minnesota's capital to break up with the football player and to collect her belongings. Free agent running back Dalvin Cook is facing domestic violence claims from a 2020 lawsuit Gracelyn Trimble - Cook's ex - claims she was offered $800k than $1M to stay quiet by Cook Trimble also alleges that she was physically and mentally abused several times by the NFL star Instead, Cook 'grabbed her by her arm and slung her whole body over the couch, slamming her face into the coffee table and causing her lower forehead and the bridge of her nose to bust open,' according to legal papers recently filed in Dakota-County District Court, first obtained by The Minneapolis Star-Tribune . Details of the filing are sealed. DailyMail.com has contacted both parties' attorneys for immediate comment. Timber also alleges that Cook followed her upstairs when she went to clean off the blood, throwing her down and pinning her to the ground before punching and choking her. He then allegedly grabbed his rifle and yelled death threats while holding her at gunpoint, according to the filing. What's more is that Timber claims that Cook beat her with a broomstick, threw her against a wall and kicked her in the hips and ribs while she laid on the ground before she ran out of his home in search of help. He later got her back into the house and confiscated her phone, the filing reports. Police were not called to the scene, a the time of the incident. This photograph from Trimble's filing shows a cut to the back of her head she blames on Cook Trimble also included several online exchanges with Cook in a sealed filing made by her lawyer Trimble did not call police to report the incident at the time and is a former US Army sergeant Trimble, pictured in her Army uniform, and Cook broke up 'for good' in May of last year A private message sent by Cook on Instagram that was included in the filing reads: 'I know what I did can be rewind...if you wanna go to the police I'll respect that I'll take my punishment for what I did! Cook, who is seeking $10M as a free agent this offseason, countersued for fraud and defamation. A police report was only filed in May of last year after the pair broke up 'for good,' according to The New York Post . Cook was involved in all of the Vikings' 17 NFL games last season, rushing for 1,173 yards. His agent, Zac Hiller, flirted with the Jets in a recent podcast interview, saying the franchise has 'a great thing going' after trading for Aaron Rodgers. But, for Cook to join New York, he would have to decrease his salary demands. The Jets have Michael Carter and Breece Hall as their only two running backs for this upcoming season. newsArray.title: Chelsea could lose wonderkid, 21, to Prem rivals for just ¬£10m with star available on free transfer next summer
creator: Ciaran Wiseman
newsArray.content: BURNLEY are trying to agree a fee for Ian Maatsen ‚Äî despite the left-back starring for Chelsea in pre-season. Maatsen , 21, was a big part of the Clarets‚Äô Championship title win last season. The Dutchman is out of contract next summer and Burnley hope to agree a ¬£10million fee plus extras. Clarets keeper Bailey Peacock-Farrell , 26, is clear to sign for Danish side Aarhus following James Trafford‚Äôs arrival. Sheffield Wednesday and Birmingham were keen, too. The Blues have also been battling to keep hold of fellow youngster Levi Colwill . Colwill starred on loan at Brighton last season, with the Seagulls amongst the clubs chasing a permanent move this summer. Chelsea are determined to keep hold of the defender, though, as they also chase additions to their squad. Brighton's Moises Caicedo has been strongly linked with a move to Stamford Bridge, with a ¬£70million bid already rejected . Seagulls boss Roberto De Zerbi has even hinted at pursuing a swap deal that would see Caicedo and Colwill moving between the two clubs. "Not only about Caicedo, also about Colwill, and maybe it can be [a swap]. "I would like to play with Caicedo and Colwill together but at the moment I can only speak about Caicedo as Colwill is not one of my players."

newsArray.title: Ashley Young insists Sean Dyche is the man to turn Everton around after back-to-back relegation battles... as the 38-year-old veteran claims it was a 'no brainer' to join Toffees this summer
newsArray.description: JOE BERNSTEIN: Young, who played alongside Sean Dyche at Watford two decades ago, describe his decision to join Everton as a 'no-brainer' after being released by Aston Villa.
newsArray.content: Ashley Young insists Sean Dyche is the man to turn Everton around after back-to-back relegation battles... as the 38-year-old veteran claims it was a 'no brainer' to join Toffees this summer Ashley Young joined his former Watford captain Sean Dyche for free this summer The 38-year-old insists Dyche is the man to help turn Everton's fortunes around Young scored on his debut as the Toffees beat League One side Wigan 1-0 By Joe Bernstein for The Mail on Sunday Updated: 20:00 BST, 22 July 2023 e-mail View comments The Everton anthem proclaims them as 'a grand old team to support' so perhaps the arrival of 38-year-old Ashley Young will prove a masterstroke. Young, who played alongside Sean Dyche when he began his career at Watford two decades ago, describe his decision to join Everton as a 'no-brainer' after being released by Aston Villa . And despite the cynics claiming the move only highlighted Everton's financial predicament, the former Manchester United , Inter Milan and England star enjoyed a fantastic debut yesterday as a winger, scoring the only goal in a 1-0 win at Wigan. Tougher challenges like ahead for sure. Everton have been perilously close to relegation in each of the last two seasons and they need to survive on a relative shoestring for one more season in order to move into their new stadium at Bramley-Moore Dock in August 2024 as a Premier League club. The club haven't paid a transfer fee for a permanent signing in the last two transfer windows and are in special measures having reported heavy financial losses over three years. Ashley Young joined Everton for free this summer after being released by Aston Villa The 38-year-old is adamant former team-mate Sean Dyche can help turn the Toffees' fortunes But Young is adamant having agreed his move to Merseyside that the Everton glass should remain half-full because of Dyche being at the helm. After all, he's a manager used to punching above his weight at Burnley and three of his squad at Turf Moore ‚Äì Dwight McNeil, James Tarkowski and Michael Keane ‚Äì are now at Goodison. 'When I played alongside Sean, I could tell he would go into management. He has that winning mentality, that spark when he walks into a dressing-room, you're aware of that presence,' he explains. 'Him and Everton is a good match and from what I've seen so far, all the players are willing to buy into it 'I knew he wanted me at Burnley before I went to Aston Villa so it was extra pull to join Everton besides the fans, players and size of the club. 'Obviously the last two seasons haven't gone as well as they should but he has the mentality to take the club higher up the table where they should be. 'The last couple of years wasn't going to put me off joining. When you put a challenge in front of me, I go full throttle. Monaco-based Farhad Moshiri (pictured) has been an absentee owner in recent years Dyche wanted watched the U21s team play on Saturday to see what he's got coming through 'They've not had a settled manager but what Sean gives, I'm feeling positive.' Certainly, Everton need some of that positivity from Young. They've become a selling club over recent times and Monaco-based Farhad Moshiri an absentee owner. He's had to take on loans to secure the building of the stadium which has impacted on the playing squad. Fans were so discontented, directors didn't go to Goodison for the second part of last season. They played well at Wigan on Saturday but it was significant assistant Ian Woan took charge because Dyche wanted to see the under-21s team play instead to see what he's got coming through. The absences of Dominic Calvert-Lewin and Amadou Onana with injuries will also be concerning given the Premier League begins in three weeks. Demarai Gray has been given time off after playing for Jamaica in the Gold Cup and he may or may not return given there is interest from other clubs. Luckily for Everton, Young is Mr Versatility and having spent his latter years as a wing-back, he looked good as a left-sided attacker, even breaking into the box to hit the winner after 63 minutes before gaining a standing ovation from hundreds of Evertonians when he was substituted later on. 'It is fluid where I'll be used. As a player you have to be ready to play in different positions,' said Young. Young (centre) insists he can't wait to play in front of the Goodison crowd next season 'I am one of those players who gives 100 per cent whatever position the manager wants. I can't wait to get to Goodison and play for the badge. I know the home fans are loud and noisy and will give everything back to you. When you get a chance to play for a big club like Everton it was a no-brainer.' One of Young's happiest Goodison memories was scoring the winner for Villa which prompted Martin O'Neill to label him a 'genius'. Everton will need a few of those this season though fans should also remember the third line of their club song which begins 'And If you know your history' The last time things looked this bleak, in 2004 when they finished 17th and then sold Wayne Rooney, David Moyes battened down the hatches the following season and Everton surprised everyone to finish in the top four! newsArray.title: Man Utd to trigger one-year deal for Wan-Bissaka despite Crystal Palace interest with transfer set to fall through
creator: Ian Tuckey
newsArray.content: MANCHESTER UNITED look ready to take up the extra year‚Äôs option on right-back Aaron Wan-Bissaka. The ex- Crystal Palace player, 25, is out of contract next summer but United have the chance to keep him beyond that. Palace would like Wan-Bissaka to return to Selhurst Park but they will not have any joy because United plan to keep the defender, who has impressed manager Erik ten Hag. The Dutchman wants to sign Axel Disasi, 25, for the position but the fee is too big and takeover issues make it difficult. Monaco may yet sell Disasi so Ten Hag is on alert ‚Äî especially if Diogo Dalot leaves Old Trafford. But Arsenal and Chelsea could be ready to nip in with a bid. It's thought that Monaco rate the four-cap Frenchman at around ¬£34million. He played all 38 of their Ligue 1 games last term. The Gunners' need for rearguard reinforcements has been eased by Jurrien Timber's arrival from Ajax . But new Chelsea chief Mauricio Pochettino wants to strengthen his squad all round. BETTING SPECIAL - BEST NO DEPOSIT CASINO OFFERS And the Blues let centre-back Kalidou Koulibaly join Saudi side Al-Hilal . United, meanwhile, appear mainly focused on bringing in a new world-class striker. But they might have to cough up close to ¬£86m for Atalanta's Rasmus Hojlund . newsArray.title: Arsenal's ¬£200m spending spree this summer means Mikel Arteta MUST now deliver... Man City and other rivals will take notice but new signings mean the future looks bright
newsArray.description: ISAAN KHAN IN NEW JERSEY: Arteta knows he must go one step further after being handed the tools he requested. There is a strength in depth to this squad that has not been there in recent years.
newsArray.content: Arsenal's ¬£200m spending spree this summer means Mikel Arteta MUST now deliver... Man City and other rivals will take notice but new signings mean the future looks bright Mikel Arteta knows he must deliver this year after a ¬£200million summer splurge The signings of Rice, Timber, and Havertz mean they have a new-found depth Stan Kroenke's American sports teams have thrived after investment recently By Isaan Khan For Mailonline Updated: 19:59 BST, 22 July 2023 e-mail 20 shares 10 View comments It was a couple of words in the lengthy dissections over what went wrong that gave away what was on the mind of Mikel Arteta in May. The party line from those within the club highlighted how much of an achievement it was for Arsenal to push Manchester City right to the wire. Besides, the north London club had finished fifth the season before ‚Äì they had last finished runners-up in 2015-16 under Arsene Wenger. This was a stark improvement. But, in reality, Arteta and Co knew they had scuppered a golden chance. It was in their hands ‚Äî until they secured three consecutive draws and a humiliation to City in April . They had choked. The following month, Arteta told Spanish newspaper Marca : ‚ÄòTo this day, it still hurts me deeply not having won the Premier League after spending 10 months fighting City. ‚ÄòThere were three or four injuries to important players and from there, everything got complicated. Mikel Arteta knows Arsenal must make another title tilt after receiving financial backing Stan Kroenke expects results after investing. His Denver Nuggets won the NBA Finals in June Arsenal won 5-0 against the MLS All-Stars team thanks to a strong first-team performance ‚ÄòWhen we had the full team, we were consistent. As soon as problems came, we couldn‚Äôt be consistent.‚Äô The message was clear: a Premier League title can only be won with a bigger, stronger squad. That warning has been more than heeded by owner Stan Kroenke , who has since splurged over ¬£200million in the past month. The signings of Kai Havertz , Jurrien Timber and Declan Rice were decisively made at the start of the window, allowing the players time to bed into the manager‚Äôs demands and plot how they can wrestle back the league this time around. It has translated into a sheer sense of optimism surrounding this club. During training near Washington DC, smiles and team bonding were commonplace. Rice, for instance, has shown signs of leadership both on and off the pitch on this US tour, and is already clearly respected among this group. Following the 5-0 thrashing of the MLS All-Stars in Washington, D.C., Arteta was beaming as he said: ‚ÄòThe idea is to be more unpredictable every year and more difficult for the opponents to stop us. We have, especially in the back and midfield, many more options than we had last season.‚Äô Though beneath the sheen of optimism, the amount of pressure, which was already heightened, is now further ramped up. When Kroenke invests heavily, he expects results. He also has had the recent taste of winning big in many sports, bar football. You only have to look at the trajectory of the other teams he owns in various league across the US. In the past 17 months, three of his clubs have won major championships. The Denver Nuggets, Los Angeles Rams and Colorado Avalanche have won an NBA Championship , the Super Bowl, and the Stanley Cup respectively. Arteta knows he must go one step further this season, especially after being handed the tools he requested. Though it is a challenge he will relish, and one which so far does not appear unfathomable. Declan Rice is the marquee signing of the summer and is already a leader in the Arsenal squad Jurrien Timber signed a five-year deal in his ¬£40.5million move from Dutch giants Ajax New man Kai Havertz was on the scoresheet against the MLS All-Stars and adds forward depth There is a sheen of optimism at Arsenal but this season they must deliver after huge spending The All-Stars match saw the manager give 21 players a chance across the 90 minutes. The performance levels did not dip, and nor was there a feeling of multiple second-string players coming on to fill the gaps. There really is a strength in depth to this squad that has not been there in recent years, and which will be noticed by their league rivals ‚Äî including Pep Guardiola‚Äôs City. The new signings also showed in glimpses why they were so sought after by the Gunners. Timber utilised unorthodox positions across the backline, Rice marshalled his team-mates into the correct positions, and Havertz put his volley challenge nightmare from the day before behind him to put in a composed display . The signs look bright indeed, but the required goal is unquestionable. Share or comment on this article: Arsenal's ¬£200m spending spree this summer means Mikel Arteta MUST now deliver... newsArray.title: Everton want to sign attacker with 17 G+A in 22/23, transfer on the cards - report
creator: Pranav Shahaney
newsArray.description: Everton are battling Marseille in the race to sign Watford winger Ismaila Sarr this summer, according to an exclusive by Santi Aouna. The Foot Mercato journalist took to Twitter to claim [22 July] that Marseille already had an offer on the table for him. Talks are ongoing with Watford over the transfer but the Senegal ... The post Everton want to sign attacker with 17 G+A in 22/23, transfer on the cards - report appeared first on Goodison News.
newsArray.content: The Foot Mercato journalist took to Twitter to claim [22 July] that Marseille already had an offer on the table for him. Talks are ongoing with Watford over the transfer but the Senegal international, 25, is open to moving to the Ligue 1 outfit this summer. Via , Aouna wrote, ‚ÄúMore details on Sarr ‚Äì OM: A first offer has already been sent by OM to the player. The Watford striker is interested. Discussions already started with the Hornets. Interest from Everton. File not linked to Iliman Ndiaye.‚Äù Sarr‚Äôs someone who‚Äôs played in the Premier League and has adapted extremely well to English football so it‚Äôs not like the country does not suit him. In fact, last season, he bagged 10 goals and seven assists in the league and was one of the Hornets‚Äô star players. He‚Äôll obviously want to leave for a top-flight side and there are no surprises that he‚Äôs open to moving to Marseille. However, should Everton come knocking at his door, there‚Äôs a very good case to be made for the 25-year-old to move to Goodison Park. Sean Dyche will absolutely love him as he can play on either flank, down the middle and even as a number 10. In fact, in the four games he played in that shadow striker role last season, he scored one and provided two assists so that could be a role he could thrive in playing behind the striker in a 4-2-3-1 system.

newsArray.title: Arsenal vs Man United - pre-season: Live score, team news and updates with Kai Havertz in line to make his first start for the Gunners against the Red Devils
newsArray.description: Follow Mail Sport's live blog for the pre-season clash between Arsenal and Manchester United in New Jersey. The Gunners defeated the MLS All Stars 5-0 on Thursday as United beat Lyon 1-0 last week.
newsArray.content: LIVE Arsenal vs Man United - pre-season: Live score, team news and updates as Andre Onana misses out on a debut while Declan Rice make first start for Arsenal By Ed Carruthers For Mailonline Updated: 21:57 BST, 22 July 2023 e-mail 704 shares 54 View comments Advertisement Follow Mail Sport's live blog for the pre-season clash between Arsenal and Manchester United in New Jersey. Ed Carruthers Host commentator 21:57 Is now the time to deliver for Mikel Arteta Tonight‚Äôs match will present a very big measuring stick for Mikel Arteta‚Äôs side to see where they are. With new faces in the squad the Arsenal manager has put up a strong side to take on Erik ten Hag‚Äôs team. But after the disappointment of last season with Arsenal falling short of the Premier League title, the club have been spending in the transfer window and have brought in some very exciting talents. Jurrien Timber, Declan Rice and Kai Havertz will all start tonight and it is an interesting night for the Gunners fans out there to see how they get on tonight. Havertz is perhaps. The most interesting of the three, having scored in his last outing for the Gunners in their 5-0 win against the MLS All Stars. If he gets back to his form of old he could be a pivotal player for Arteta this season. It will also be very interesting to see how Declan Rice fits in alongside Martin Odegaard and Jorginho tonight, after the former West Ham captain made his debut for the club last week. Arsenal's ¬£200m spending spree means Mikel Arteta MUST now deliver ISAAN KHAN IN NEW JERSEY: Arteta knows he must go one step further after being handed the tools he requested. There is a strength in depth to this squad that has not been there in recent years. Mail Online 21:43 Takeover talk: Avram Glazer turns up at United's US training camp Interestingly, Avram Glazer turned up at United's training camp and met with Erik ten Hag earlier this week. United are still in the midst of a takeover, and the Dutch manager told the media that he would be happy to give his 'advice and recommendations' to the owners over the takeover saga. More below... Man United owner Avram Glazer turns up at club's US training camp CHRIS WHEELER IN NEW JERSEY: Glazer has been the most visible member of the family, turning up at the finals of the FA Cup and Carabao Cup last season as well as the Women's FA Cup final. Mail Online 21:40 A busy week for Erik ten Hag Erik ten Hag has certainly had plenty to think about this week. The Man United boss ticked off another box bringing Andre Onana into his squad following David de Gea's departure. He also stripped Harry Maguire of the captains arm band and gave the leadership duties to Bruno Fernandes. But the Dutch manager is still hoping to make a few more signings before the end of the transfer window with United hoping to bring in a new striker following the departure of Wout Weghorst last season. Weghorst failed to score goals up top and the Red Devils are eyeing up Rasmus Hojlund as a replacement. In fact, the Dutch manager yesterday vowed that he would be signing a striker this summer despite the club being frustrated by Atalanta's ¬£86million price tag. ‚ÄòWe will do everything that's in our power to get the right man in,‚Äô said Ten Hag. ‚ÄòYou never know in the transfer market, but we know our targets and we‚Äôll do everything we can. We put every effort in to get this done because it's an area where we need improvement. ‚ÄòWe proved also last season we can be very successful even though we didn't have too many strikers. I expect more from the front players, a high level. They have to raise the bar and we expect more goals.‚Äô Erik ten Hag vows Man United 'will do everything' to sign a striker CHRIS WHEELER: United have acquired midfielder Mason Mount and goalkeeper Andre Onana in this transfer window, but Ten Hag has made signing a new centre-forward a priority. Mail Online 21:33 And United are in the house too! And Manchester United are in the house too! The team are taking in all the atmosphere at this enormous stadium and seem in good spirits ahead of the match. It also looks like Arsenal are set to wear their jazzy new yellow away kit that has received a lot of attention from some among their fan base with some saying the controversial design is 'not appropriate for Champions League football .' (Photo by Stuart MacFarlane/Arsenal FC via Getty Images) 21:21 Andre Onana misses out Erik ten Hag has chosen to leave new signing Andre Onana out of his matchday squad. The shot-stopper jetted into New Jersey on Friday after completing his ¬£47million move from Inter Milan. Interestingly, the Serie A outfit are currently interested in signing David de Gea, who made way for the Cameroonian following what was an unceremonious departure from Old Trafford earlier this summer. Onana, meanwhile immediately begun training with the Red Devils this week in the States, but will not feature tonight. Tom Heaton, who was refused a move to Luton this summer, will start in net for the match with Dean Henderson edging closer to a move to Nottingham Forest. One of his greatest attributes is his passing ability and it could be a sign to come from Mikel Arteta, with Timber‚Äôs versatility giving him another option in defence alongside William Sailba, Gabriel and Takehiro Tomiyasu. But the Gunners showed their quality on Thursday night, putting five past Wayne Rooney‚Äôs side with Bukayo Saka and Gabriel Jesus proving a nuisance all game against the US outfit. Erik ten Hag‚Äôs team meanwhile, bested French side Lyon 1-0 in their opening match, with Donny van de Been getting on the scoresheet just before half-time. newsArray.title: Genk 2-0 Burnley: Vincent Kompany's men suffer first pre-season defeat in Belgium as James Trafford makes debut following ¬£19m Manchester City switch
newsArray.description: An eighth-minute goal from Yira Sor and a late hit from Tolu Arokodare saw the Belgians over the line on a frustrating evening for Vincent Kompany.
newsArray.content: Genk 2-0 Burnley: Vincent Kompany's men suffer first pre-season defeat in Belgium as James Trafford makes debut following ¬£19m Manchester City switch Burnley fell 2-0 to Belgian league runners-up Genk after early and late strikes James Trafford made his debut and Andros Townsend played as a trialist Vincent Kompany's side suffered their first pre-season loss in Belgium By Luke Power For Mailonline Updated: 16:12 EDT, 22 July 2023 e-mail 161 shares View comments Burnley 's unbeaten pre-season record has been ripped up as they lost 2-0 at KRC Genk. An eighth-minute goal from Yira Sor and a late hit from Tolu Arokodare saw the Belgians over the line on a frustrating evening for Vincent Kompany . James Trafford made his debut between the sticks for the Lancashire outfit after signing for ¬£19m from Manchester City but could not carry his clean sheets record from the U21s Euros into this game. Striker Zeki Amdouni, who recently signed from Basel after 22 goals there last season , came on as a substitute, while Andros Townsend featured as a trialist. It was a nightmare start for the Clarets when Sor converted just eight minutes after kick-off, following up after Angelo Preciado's effort was blocked. James Trafford, pictured after winning the U21s Euros with England, debuted as Burnley lost Vincent Kompany's side are preparing for their first season back in the Premier League after winning the Championship Josh Brownhill looked to get his side back in it around 16 minutes in but saw his attempted denied by a defender's legs. Scott Twine was a lively presence for Burnley and could have scored in either half. He rapped a half-volley wide of the mark early into the second half. The hosts almost added a second when new signing Christopher Bonsu Baah smacked a long-range attempt, but it went wide. But Genk got their reward for persistence in the closing minutes as Arokodare found the net for the home side in their last pre-season friendly.
